content.title: Popliteal Artery Anatomy
content.description: Continuation of SFA through the popliteal fossa, giving rise to genicular branches and terminating as the tibial trifurcation.
content.termination: Anterior tibial (first branch), then tibioperoneal trunk → posterior tibial and peroneal

segments.P1: Above knee, from adductor hiatus to joint line

popliteal_fossa.contents: Artery deepest, vein superficial to artery, tibial nerve most superficial

content.statement: Popliteal Artery Anatomy is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Anatomy Lower-Extremity that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Popliteal Artery Anatomy helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Popliteal Artery Anatomy include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Popliteal Artery Anatomy.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Popliteal Artery Anatomy. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
